original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stocks closed down on Tuesday. The Colombo All Share Index was down 0.37 percent, or 38.52 points, at 10,507.
The S&P SL20 index of liquid stocks was down 0.19 percent, or 5.53 points at 2,972.
Turnover was at 912 million. Major contributing sectors to the day’s turnover were capital goods (217 mn), banks (128 mn), consumer durables and apparel (123 mn), and energy (112).
The top contributors to the ASPI included Commercial Bank of Ceylon Plc (up at 84.00), Cargills (Ceylon) Plc (up at 370.00), and Industrial Asphalts (Ceylon) Plc (up at 0.30).
There was a net foreign outflow of 31 million. (Colombo/Nov21/2023)
